description:
Approach

Trail from the parking lot goes to the base of the upper (Angel) falls. Bushwhacking to the top on either side of the falls is doable. Although steep, it is not too dense vegetation.

Descent

2 rappels connected by a somewhat overgrown creek. Top rappel is almost completely dry when at low water levels and not worth going to in such conditions.

R1 (Panther Falls), the rope can get stuck in the canopy if you pull from near the bridge/viewpoint at the base.

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

https://www.atlantatrails.com/hiking-trails/angel-falls-trail-lake-rabun-hiking/

Trip reports and media

Background
name: Joe Creek
